security_audit.summary: Legitimate bioinformatics skill containing workflow generation and file validation scripts for NGS data analysis. No malicious behavior, network calls, or credential access detected. All code serves documented scientific purpose.

content.user_title: Analyze NGS sequencing data with deepTools
content.value_statement: Process and visualize next-generation sequencing data for ChIP-seq, RNA-seq, and ATAC-seq experiments. Convert BAM files to normalized coverage tracks, generate quality control metrics, and create publication-ready heatmaps and profiles.
actual_capabilities: Convert BAM alignment files to normalized bigWig coverage tracks
Generate quality control plots including correlation heatmaps, PCA, and fingerprints
Create publication-ready heatmaps and profile plots around genomic features
Compare treatment and control samples with log2 ratio tracks
Validate input files (BAM, bigWig, BED) before analysis
Generate reusable workflow scripts for common NGS analyses
limitations: Requires deepTools and samtools installation on your system
Does not perform read alignment or peak calling (expects aligned BAM files)
Does not provide statistical analysis beyond correlation and PCA
Memory intensive for whole-genome analyses on large BAM files

output_examples.input: Convert my ChIP-seq BAM files to normalized coverage tracks and check quality
output: Generated Input_coverage.bw and ChIP_coverage.bw using RPGC normalization
Fingerprint shows strong ChIP enrichment (Jensen-Shannon distance: 0.42)

best_practices: Always validate BAM files with corresponding .bai indices before running deepTools
Use RPGC or CPM normalization for comparable coverage across samples with different sequencing depths
Run quality control (plotFingerprint, correlation) before proceeding to downstream analysis
anti_patterns: Using --extendReads for RNA-seq data (will incorrectly span splice junctions)
Comparing samples with different normalization methods
Running whole-genome analysis without testing parameters on a chromosome subset first

faq.question: Which normalization method should I use for ChIP-seq?
faq.answer: Use RPGC or CPM for ChIP-seq coverage tracks. RPGC provides interpretable coverage values and requires the effective genome size parameter.

faq.question: Can deepTools process single-end sequencing data?
faq.answer: Yes, but specify fragment length with --fragmentLength for proper read extension. Paired-end data is recommended when available.

faq.question: How do I install deepTools?
faq.answer: Install with pip: pip install deeptools or uv pip install deeptools. Requires Python 3.7 or newer.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using these tools?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only processes files locally on your machine. No data is transmitted externally. All operations occur on your filesystem.

faq.question: Why is my bigWig file so large?
faq.answer: Reduce file size by increasing binSize (e.g., --binSize 50) or using bigWig format which is compressed. Process chromosomes individually for very large genomes.

faq.question: How does this compare to other NGS tools like deeptools?
faq.answer: This skill IS the deepTools wrapper. It provides Claude integration for generating commands, workflows, and documentation for the official deepTools suite.
